definitions: To pass into or through (a substance) by filtering or by penetrating the interstices.
To enter or become established in surreptitiously, especially so as to gain control or acquire secret information.
To cause (a liquid, for example) to permeate something by penetrating its interstices.
To pass (troops, for example) in small groups through gaps in the enemy line.
examples: The spies infiltrated the enemy organization.
The agent successfully infiltrated the network.
Small units infiltrated behind enemy lines.
